summary: This document is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to Expedia, Inc., demanding records related to flights purchased, booked, or taken by Ghislaine Maxwell. It includes a transmittal form showing service of the subpoena on January 31, 2020, and a request for non-disclosure to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The individual for whom all flight records are being subpoenaed from Expedia, Inc., as part of a federal grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is authorizing the grand jury subpoena targeting Maxwell's flight records as part of a criminal investigation.
Gaskill, as a recipient at Expedia, is being served a subpoena to produce records related to Maxwell's flights.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issues a grand jury subpoena to Expedia, Inc., demanding records related to Ghislaine Maxwell's flights.

events.title: Subpoena Served on Expedia
events.description: National Registered Agents, Inc. serves the grand jury subpoena and related documents on Expedia, Inc. in Seattle, WA.

events.title: Scheduled Appearance/Production Date
events.description: The deadline for Expedia to produce the subpoenaed records to the FBI or appear before the grand jury.

locations: 1111 Expedia Group Way W., Seattle, WA 98119
One St. Andrews Plaza, New York, NY 10007
28 Liberty Street, New York County (Manhattan), New York, NY 10005
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, New York, NY
keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued to Expedia, Inc. on January 27, 2020, as part of a criminal investigation into suspected felony violations of 18 U.S.C. ยง 2423(a) (transportation for illegal sexual activity).
The subpoena specifically demands 'any and all records' regarding flights purchased, booked, or taken by Ghislaine Maxwell.
The U.S. Attorney's Office explicitly requested that Expedia voluntarily refrain from disclosing the existence of the subpoena to any third party to preserve the confidentiality of the investigation.
The document shows the investigative focus on Maxwell's travel patterns and the use of commercial travel services like Expedia in early 2020.
The subpoena was served via a registered agent in New York and transmitted to Expedia's headquarters in Seattle on January 31, 2020.
